snippet: California's $26 billion agriculture industry, already wracked by infestations of the Mexican, Mediterranean and Oriental fruit flies, is being hit by the olive fruit fly.    State officials said on Friday that they had created a 58-square-mile qu...
lead_paragraph: California's $26 billion agriculture industry, already wracked by infestations of the Mexican, Mediterranean and Oriental fruit flies, is being hit by the olive fruit fly. State officials said on Friday that they had created a 58-square-mile quarantine zone in Southern California after 10 olive fruit flies were detected in the Westwood area of Los Angeles.
abstract: California's $26 billion agriculture industry--already wracked by infestations of Mexican, Mediterranean and Oriental fruit flies--is being infected by olive fruit fly; officials have created 58-square-mile quarantine zone in Southern California after 10 olive fruit flies were detected in Westwood area of Los Angeles (S)

headline.main: Olive Fruit Fly Poses Danger To Agriculture in California
